titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Midwifery Education Accreditation Council records SSC.MS.00759

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-15 15:17:42 -0400.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.
Finding aid updated to current standards and published

did.abstract: Founded in 1991 by the National Coalition of Midwifery Educators, the Midwifery Education Accreditation Council (MEAC) serves as a non-profit and nationally recognized accrediting agency, making midwifery more accepted as it becomes more professionalized. The collection contains accreditation documentation, reports, minutes, agendas, and correspondence.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Periodic accruals to collection are expected.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1991 by the National Coalition of Midwifery Educators, the Midwifery Education Accreditation Council (MEAC) serves as a non-profit and nationally recognized accrediting agency which seeks "to promote excellence in midwifery education through accreditation"(http://meacschools.org/about-meac/). Approved by the US Department of Education on a recurring basis since 1991, MEAC has helped make midwifery more accepted as it has become more professionalized.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Midwifery Education Accreditation Council records, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00759, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accreditation documentation, reports, minutes, agendas, and correspondence.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Sandra Bitonti Stewart, Executive Director of Midwifery Education Accreditation Council, 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Midwifery Education Accreditation Council grants Smith College Special Collections non-exclusive, non-competitive copyright authority for all materials created by them and given to the archives. However, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by [donor/creator], researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
